name: Earnings Payout Ratio
description: Assesses dividend affordability from profits by comparing dividends to adjusted net income.

name: Free Cash Flow Payout Ratio
description: Evaluates dividends against real cash flow by comparing dividends to free cash flow.

name: Debt-to-Equity Ratio
description: Measures financial leverage by comparing total debt to shareholder equity.

name: Interest Coverage Ratio
description: Gauges ability to service debt by comparing EBIT to interest expense.

name: Cash Flow Volatility
description: Rewards predictable cash flow by computing the standard deviation-to-mean ratio of free cash flow over a trailing window.

name: Dividend Growth Streak
description: Counts consecutive years of dividend-per-share growth to capture dividend commitment.

name: Revenue Drawdown in Recessions
description: Measures resilience by calculating peak-to-trough revenue decline during stressed periods.

name: Quick Ratio
description: Assesses short-term liquidity by comparing (cash + receivables) to current liabilities.

name: Cash Dividend Coverage
description: Evaluates cash cushion by determining how many years of dividends are covered by cash on hand.
